Below is a complete list of terms and definitions used in the ISDSE project. We follow the conventions of referencing Indigenous Peoples/peoples [here](https://www.noslangues-ourlanguages.gc.ca/en/writing-tips-plus/capitalization-indigenous-person-people). 

```{r}
#| echo: false
#| results: asis
#| warning: false

library(yaml)
vars <- read_yaml("../_variables.yml")
glossary_list <- vars$glossary

print_sorted_glossary <- function(g_list) {
  # 1. Extract titles and definitions into a data frame for easy sorting
  extracted <- lapply(g_list, function(item) {
    title <- regmatches(item, regexec('title="([^"]*)"', item))[[1]][2]
    definition <- regmatches(item, regexec('data-bs-content="([^"]*)"', item))[[1]][2]
    return(c(title = title, def = definition))
  })
  
  df <- as.data.frame(do.call(rbind, extracted), stringsAsFactors = FALSE)
  
  # 2. Sort by title (alphabetical order)
  df_sorted <- df[order(df$title), ]
  
  # 3. Print the results
  for (i in 1:nrow(df_sorted)) {
    cat(paste0("**", df_sorted$title[i], "**: ", df_sorted$def[i], "\n\n"))
  }
}

print_sorted_glossary(glossary_list)
```
